name: Holiday Inn Express Birch Run (Frankenmuth Area)

reviews.text: The staff was super!!! We have stayed in a lot of places and have never been treated so well! The entire hotel was clean and inviting. The breakfast was the best that has ever been offered at any hotel that we have stayed in. We will certainly be staying here everytime we return to the area!!!
reviews.title: What an awesome place
nice Hotel
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, but only one elevator which can cause a long line during busy periods.
the breakfast was very good. Nice clean rooms.
reviews.title: awesome place best free breakfast

reviews.text: I did not know what to expect never been to the area before. On arrive we were early, but the front desk check and the room was ready so we were able to get in early and the front desk employee was extremely friendly and helpful because this was our first time to the area he gave us suggestions to place to go too. The room was a surprise how good the room was the beds were great and most comfortable, the tv was a flat widescreen which did not expect, very clean room and bathroom (which I'm very picky about) the room includes fridge and microwave no extra charge. Also the desk chair was very comfortable plus it had a reclining chair which is a nice bonus. The salt water pool was very nice and warm. Now the free breakfast I was not expecting such a large selection most free breakfast are just continent ones, but here you get scramble eggs, sausages, biscuits, gravy, warm cininamon buns, ceral, hot oatmeal, yogurt, bread, french toast(put in toaster kind), danishes, muffins,bagels, juices, coffee all you can eat also. So over all we will be back and I recommand this hotel to everyone. We stay on the first floor near the front lobby it was great location. close to pool, breakfast get in and out of hotel. For shopping prime outlet was ok but we found the malls in outer area better we went to Genses Valley Centre about 20 mins south of Birch run large one and
reviews.title: What a nice place

reviews.text: Fashion Square about 25 minutes north of Birch run small one
reviews.title: very pleased
Clean Hotel, Friendly Staff!
reviews.text: Spent the weekend in Birch Run with family. Booked here for two nights and requested an adjoining room which we were given without problem. Rooms, though a little dated, are super-clean (*very important for members of the family we were traveling with!). Pool was lovely and breakfast was great, too - lots of choices and loved the pancake machine! Also this hotel is so very close to the outlets and restaurants, so awesome for shopping and eating out. Great experience overall - this was our second time staying here and we were all very pleased! Keep up the good work!

reviews.title: A good price for sure!
reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed at this hotel. We found it clean and the staff friendly. However, the bathroom seemed a little tired. The drain in the shower was extremely slow. The wallpaper was beginning to come apart at the seams The fact that we couldn't leave the bathroom door open was a real nuisance to us. It seems that it would be to close to the heat lamp if it was in the open position. Not big problems, just the facts
As regular travelers to Birch Run, we have stayed at many hotels in the area. Holiday Inn Express used to be our favourite, but we felt it had gone down hill in terms of cleanliness & service.
reviews.title: So much has improved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because I am a Priority Club member, we decided to try it again this trip, and we're glad we did.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great location

reviews.text: Service from everyone was impeccable… from the front desk, to the cleaning staff, to the breakfast bar attendant, to the manager. We were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great choice for shopping, nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very clean property with very friendly and courteous staff. Rooms were pretty standard; nothing too exciting to write about.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel, but bring your earplugs
Staff is very friendly and ready to help with any request.
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.title: Awesome Hotel
reviews.text: Great location close to Birch Run outlet mall and Frankenmuth area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel staff are fast and friendly at this secure location. You can leave your cares behind while in your jetted tub or at their buffie breakfasts.
reviews.title: Holiday recovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area has a lot to offer from the outlet malls close by to "Frankenmuth" the Little Bravarian town. Christmas is a great time to vist here.
reviews.title: Great spot to stay near outlet mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is clean, located right off the interstate, nice breakfast.
reviews.title: What a FInd!

reviews.text: We paid $80 for a Monday night stay. What a great find! Very large pool and reception/breakfast area. Lots of families as it was Christmas break, but we asked for a quiet room and they gave us one on the third floor which was very quiet. Seems like the families are roomed on the first floor near the pool. They sure didn't bother us. Great HOT breakfast with eggs and sausage, etc. The room was fine, very clean, well-appointed with two sinks and a large bathroom. I generally don't like those wall-mounted air conditioner/heater units as they're noisy and drafty. We turned ours off and were comfortable all night (in December!) On checking out, we mentioned the shower head was weak, and they said they would get right on it. The hotel manager was all over the place checking to make sure things were going well. If you're visiting Birch Run outlets or Frankenmuth, this is great.. If you have kids, it's greater.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Great hotel for the price. Stayed for business, but was close enough to do shopping! Clean. Great breakfast. Great rates. And very friendly and helpful staff. Room had fridge and microwave which was great for leftovers. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel seems like it is very new. It's very clean and super close to Birch Run but not backing onto the highway so the rooms are quiet. The beds/pillows are comfortable, rooms are a nice size. The pool is salt water, nice touch. The pool/hot tub area was clean and enjoyable. My husband went out to the vehicle the first night to retrieve something and security drove by and made sure that he was a guest and not someone breaking into our vehicle. The reception staff were very friendly, that is always a nice first impression!
reviews.title: Okay, but.....

reviews.text: The not-so-good:
reviews.title: Great birthday trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym only had a treadmill, bike and weight machine and was very small. When working out, I tend to work up a sweat and would prefer cool air to warm air, even in March, so it would have been nice if there was a fan in the room. Even if there was a timer on the wall to turn it off and on at will.
reviews.title: New

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was disappointing. I'm on a diet and work out, so I wanted protein. The scrambled eggs were salty and watery (couldn't eat them), my husband tried the sausage patty which was disgusting, the oatmeal (I think that's what it was) looked like mushy soup. The second day I had pancakes which were good. Get there early if you want decaf coffee. To improve I'd suggest: omit salt in the eggs; have ham or breakfast sausages instead of sausage patties; provide instant oatmeal packets and hot water so people can make their own.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: As I start all reviews, please take a look and see how many hotels I've reviewed, I'm not a jaded one time traveler. I travel often and feel I have a good base to write a good overall review. I won this hotel on hotwire and can say that it was a disappointment when you think you're getting a 3 star hotel and you get a 2. but I can't fault the hotel for hotwires poor rating system.
reviews.title: 2 star in Birch Run.

reviews.text: This hotel is very central if you plan on taking in the outlet mall or Frankenmuth. If you have business in Saginaw it is a bit of a drive.
reviews.title: A Family Get Together

reviews.text: The hotel appears to have been built in the late 90's or early 2000's. The interior now has a tired look and is in need of a renovation. The design of the building is almost funny as to where the elevators are located. Very poorly marked.
reviews.title: Shopping Get-a-Way

reviews.text: All the furniture, carpet and walls are in fair condition. The room was clean as were all public areas. My door did not feel very secure and the for some reason the bathroom door needs to always remain closed due to where they installed the heat lamp?
reviews.title: Clean, no frills

reviews.text: The room has a fridge and micro as well as a flat screen. Which is very nice to have.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY

reviews.text: This hotel is what you'd expect from the chain. We got a clean, spacious room in a well-maintained, safe hotel. This hotel was more expensive than an other one we stayed at in the same area, and for that money we got a large, spotlessly clean, seeming newly refurbished room. The breakfast was very nice and the front desk staff was cheerful and efficient.
reviews.title: What you'd expect from a Holiday Inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel in a fabulous location.
reviews.title: Great Stay ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this motel to be very clean. The continental breakfast was very nice. We had a jacuzzi room and found everything to be clean, neat and fresh. The jacuzzi itself was especially clean, soothing and relaxing. The bed was comfortable. Our room also had a small refrigerator and a microwave. Motel is close to the Outlet Mall and also to Frankenmuth. We will stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at a reasonable price
Great Place for Shopping Trip
reviews.text: People were great at check in. Hotel offered a wide range of accomodations. Excellent hot continental breakfast included with the room cost.
My best friend and I travelled to Birch Run for some outlet shopping. We chose the Holiday Inn based on price and TI reviews. It was perfect for what we wanted.
reviews.title: Not the best in the area, but great customer service.

reviews.text: Our group stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend. The hotel was almost fully booked. Although the hotel is away from the outlet mall, it is only a five minute drive and within walking distance to restaurants (5-7 minute walk to KFC, Halo Burger, Oscar and Joey's).
reviews.title: Not a bad place to stay in Birch Run

reviews.text: Our standard room with 2 beds was spacious and relatively clean. The hotel puts some sort of flooring in the bathtub to avoid slippage and this was peeling around the drain area. The room was relatively clean but I didn't think the bathtub flooring was cleaned well (probably needed to replace it).
reviews.title: Wish we stayed somewhere else

reviews.text: The breakfast was okay. It's a decent hot buffet with some variety. Avoid the pancakes as the machine that makes it doesn't always work properly and the pancake doesn't taste like one. Holiday Inn should make their hot drink station available all day as this would be a nice thing to have (Hampton Inn has this feature), like their fresh baked cookies in the evenings.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Birch Run!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, not a bad place to stay if you are planning a shopping trip to Birch Run. Nice sized indoor pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Overall disappointed!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2012 and it was the worst night's sleep I have had at a hotel and I love staying in hotels. They put us on the first floor near the vending machine and near the exterior door. The doors slammed closed late into the evening and very early in the morning. I understand that kids make noise, but kids were running up and down the hallway. The walls are so thin you can hear everyone in the next room and walking above us in their room. We had booked through expedia and I guess this is what you get when you book through an outside org to get a cheaper price. My recommendation is to just not stay at this place, there are many other hotels around.
reviews.title: family party

reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express is and excellent location for those who are planning a shopping trip to the Premium Outlets in Birch Run. I travel with two friends each summer on a trip that is exclusively outlet mall shopping. Last year we stayed at another hotel in Birch Run and it was a disaster. Therefore, we were delighted with the change this year at the Holiday Inn Express. Pleasant staff, clean efficient rooms, great pool and whirl pool as well as a small exercise room. The breakfast was plentiful, hot, and healthful.
reviews.title: Best Shopping Situation in Birch Run

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here to be close to the outlet shopping at Birch Run AND to visit nearby Frankenmuth. The Pros: Staff was GREAT and very friendly! Room was clean and what you'd expect from a Holiday Inn Express-was surprised by the fridge and microwave; wasn't expecting that. The pool area was clean. The free breakfast had everything from a pancake maker, eggs, sausage, etc. to cold cereal, muffins, yoguart, etc. and the eating area is quite large and food was well stocked! I would get there early, it did get busy after the first hour. The Cons: If I were to nit-pick...I asked for the 3rd floor in order to cut down on noise from the floor above-but they put us right next to the elevator. A little loud until things settled down after 10pm. (We didn't bother asking to move, tho'.) The bathroom door would not stay open. You wouldn't think that would bother you, but somehow it did. We just stuck a towel on the floor to hold it open. The beds were not the most comfortable. But I"ve had much worse. At least they give you several pillows, both firm and soft, to choose from. The games in the gameroom "ate" our quarters, but they promptly refunded our money. All in all, a decent stay at a great price and I would stay here again in a heartbeat! It's hard to find friendly staff at places anymore and here, even the cleaning staff greeted us with smiles in the morning!!
reviews.title: Nice stay, nice price in a great area!

reviews.text: We visited this hotel with our teenage grandchildren and found this hotel in a good location for shopping and visiting Frankenmuth. Our dog was welcome.
reviews.title: Nice Family Hotel, the staff were very friendly, the hotel was clean and quiet. Close to shopping mall and Frankenmuth

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and the hotel is clean with comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Not a terrible place but lots of problems.

reviews.text: The positive is the rooms in this hotel are nice and I suspect during the week it's not bad. But during the weekend when the place is croweded it's not ideal.
reviews.title: Will definiteley stay there again!!

reviews.text: I've been staying at this Holiday Inn Express for at least the last three years. I know most of the employees on a first name basis. Everyone has always treated me like family there. I would not stay at another hotel in the area even if it was for a lower rate... I like this Holiday Inn Express! Furthermore, with the quality of service that these people provide, they deserve to be commended. Or even better, they deserve an increase in pay!! I would recommend this Holiday Inn Express to any one of my friends or family that needed to stay in the Birch Run area. And all they would have to do when they came into the front desk is tell the host/hostess that I sent them, and they would be fully taken care of. This is a first class hotel.
reviews.title: Great Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: Toilet didn't flush, beds are hard as a rock and to top it all off the manager who you couldn't understand confronted my 8 year old daughter and I about not wearing shoes while having our breakfast so we could then go to the pool afterwards only 20 feet away. We were fully clothed yet others were in just shorts and no shirts. He picked on us and badger us all the way down the hall until I finally lashed back at him when he stated get out of my hotel in 5 minutes or I'm calling the police. Guess what I'm going to corporate. Absolutely absurd!!!
reviews.title: Manager kicked us out for no shoes!!

reviews.text: I like this Holiday Inn Express ... I travel through the area a couple times a year and my first choice is always this Hotel ... The building is modern and updated, the rooms are spacious clean and tidy, and the staff has always been pleasant with me. I must always get an upgrade of some sort as I always end up with a room that has a spa in it ... My rooms have always had a Microwave and refrigerator and I must say I love the flat screen TV's ... The bedding is updated and very comfortable. The pool is inside and open year round, except for one trip when it was closed for maintenance ... The breakfast is quite a spread if you like the usual hotel buffet .. After 14 years of traveling I don't really get into it anymore ... Being less than a mile from the Birch Run Outlet Mall there are tons of restaurants, fast and otherwise, to grab my meals ... I will continue to stay here as I travel through the area, no problem ...
reviews.title: Nice Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: The hotel is near Frankenmuth and that was the purpose of our trip. It's a clean hotel but the staff was very rude and even after asking for a quiet room we were put directly outside of the elevator on the 2nd floor. People were slamming their doors up until 11:30pm. We called the front desk to report the noise and finally took it upon ourselves to ask the loud teenages outside to be quiet because our kids were sleeping. The shower in our room was also very loud and squealed when you turned on the water. When checking out the next day after very little sleep from elevator traffic we again told the front desk how loud the room was and how dissatisfied we were. Apparently other people also reported the noise on the 2nd floor. They credited our Priority Rewards 1,000 and that was it. That's the equivalent of a lollipop and have a good day. Very disappointed.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel, Horrible Evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I have stayed here several times one of those times being for Our local honeymoon Dec 2010 we had a great time in a two room suite.There was plenty of room for the three days we were there during a big snow storm.
reviews.title: Love Staying Here

reviews.text: Hotel is just the other side of the overpass from the Birch Run Premium outlets and about 10 minutes from Frankenmuth. We were five women and we had two interconnecting rooms on the third floor. Rooms were two queens with lots of space to enjoy gossip and beverages. Beds and pillows were comfy, bathrooms were clean and the room temps were comfortable.This hotel
reviews.title: great base for a girls' weekend away

reviews.text: has en elevator to get to all levels. The bathroom door closes on its own and we did find the bathroom held a little musty odor. We did mention it to the front desk about having a door stop to keep air flow into this room.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: The indoor pool is a good size with a giant hot tub, as well as an exercise room and large lobby that doubles as their breakfast area in the morning. Breakfast was excellent and just as a special note, the cinnamon buns are to die for.
reviews.title: Average Property For This Major Hotel Chain

reviews.text: The ladies at reception are amazing and have all kinds of coupons and information for the area. Know that the streets in Birch Run roll up after 10pm, including pizza delivery so make sure you have supper planned or ordered before 9:30pm.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: A great stop and I would stay here again. I know we all enjoyed our stay. Thank you to the our hosts, Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Good stay for the price

reviews.text: Tired of hugely overpriced rooms in frankenmuth so me and my family decided to stay here. Huge room and good ammenities. Little pricey but worth it with AAA discount. Would stay again. Pool was a bit warm but very clean. Staff was excellent.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: This was our 3rd. time staying here ..beds just as comfortable and a great choices for breakfast ..for your dollar I would not hesitate recommending this hotel..staff friendly and helpful and convenient location
reviews.title: Good value for your $

reviews.text: I was hoping to stay in downtown Frankenmuth, and soon found out that even in May on the weekends many hotels were full. This hotel was an after thought and I was apprehensive.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room: Clean, spacious, bathroom and vanity very satisfactory
reviews.title: Nice, clean, convenient

reviews.text: The staff: I had a problem with the internet, they were helpful, not put off or seem bothered by my questions. It was easily fixed.
reviews.title: We have a wonderful stay here

reviews.text: Front desk staff, at all shifts, are terrific! They go out of their way to ensure everything was first rate during our stay. Our room was on the second floor and was quiet and comfortable. I only rated the sleep quality as "very good" since I was coming down with bronchitis during my stay and didn't sleep well.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: This was a great experience for our yearly family trip, my wife and kids. We even had friends come from Chicago, mother & son to stay with us at the Frankenmuth Holiday Inn Hotel for our Christmas break in december 2012. The food was excellent and the whirlpool was an excellent experience. We came to see the largest christmas store in the whole world which was awesome.
reviews.title: Family experience

reviews.text: Visiting Frankenmuth and wanted to stay where it was less hectic and a bit more economic. This facility filled the bill. Friendly and accomodating staff. Clean rooms with refrig & microwave. Facility is just far enough off the Interstate so that the noise isn't an issue. Breakfast bar was the typical HIE food, but it was hot and fresh. All in all, a pleasant stay. Would stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Frankenmuth area

reviews.text: I want to start by saying the staff is wonderful. We encountered several staff members and each was friendly and helpful. The hotel & room was well-situated given our particular needs on this stay (we were traveling with a dog & an elderly travel companion). We had a microwave, coffee and refrigerator in our room. The hotel stay includes wireless internet and breakfast. The breakfast was clean and hearty. We didn't use the pool or workout room, but both looked clean.
reviews.title: Overall, pretty good experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was not great was the mattress & pillows, which turned into not a great nights sleep. Neither was bad, just not like home and not great.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

aka: Holiday Inn Express Birch Run (Frankenmuth Area) Hotel Birch Run
description: change Primary photo from ownerphoto edit
